Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content: @dukeleto HUSH seems to work just fine on nspv, yet there are but 1 good node to connect. Thus, timeout errors are frequent. Unless you manually disable node discovery.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Sir Seven latest version automatically limits the sending amount to 0.0001 less than the max amount you have. plz test this

Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content:
With curl and API it always result in error `not enough funds`.
In webUI any amount more than (balance - 0.0001) will result in autolimited tx.

Note: there is txfee param in coins file, we might use it here.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Sir Seven thanks, you are correct. Notary nodes are not yet running versions of HUSH which enable nSPV, so we only have 1 full node with nspv services right now

Author: Don King#8901
Content: Can the new nspv wallet be used for other coins like Agama could, e.g. Bitcoin?

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: For other notarized SmartChains like RFOX DEX REVS etc yes

Author: Don King#8901
Content: Ok, just KMD and smartchains, thanks!

Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: @Don King  Bitcoin may be the gateway drug into the potential of crypto but it will not be the "killer app" that takes crypto to mainstream adoption. Even those in charge of it's development are documented as being in favor of it's role as reserve asset.

Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: the eradication of ECMAscript from crypto transactions is key to it's security and feasibility for mobile, low bandwidth applications. credit card machines don't run internet browsers for a reason.

Author: Don King#8901
Content: @actionslacks , I agree btc is probably the crypto reserve currency like gold used to be in the fiat world. I really liked being able to use Agama for other coins though, that was a cool feature!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: latest jl777 branch might not work anymore on 32bit or windows, not sure

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i added a bunch of jpeg code and curve25519. it should be ok, but not sure

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Sir Seven can you verify if it still works on windows

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is hardcoded now to use a .jpg file called test.jpg and from that it makes a dest.jpg with the wif steganographically encoded. but the password is very silly, so dont use real passphrases yet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the idea is that you can save your wif inside a .jpg protected with a password.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: without knowing which .jpg if was and the password, then it cant be extracted

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course using a fixed location test.jpg and a fixed passphrase defeats this, but it was just a lot of code to get the basic functionality working

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c that is really awesome, looking forward to trying this feature out

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: unless the .jpg is really small it should be impossible to visually see any changes

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Havent really been following along but what are the benefits to using the jpg? Just a 2fa of sorts?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is like pin code,but there isnt any data directly associated with nspv

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: plausible deniability when computer is searched for crypto accounts

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you have nspv data in local storage, they will taser you if you dont divulge your password

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you have nspv data in local storage, they will taser you if you dont divulge your password

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: seems just better if there is no direct evidence that nspv ever was on the computer

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can make arbitrary number of decoy .jpg linked to small balances

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the possibilities seem quite flexible. you can send the .jpg image as a gift with the password for it divulged separately for inheritance purposes

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: I wonder if you can encode the jpg with yubikeys

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: So you would need both the hardware key and the pic

Content: @jl777c you will also be able to put a 200KB JPG image into the memo field of any kmd sapling chain, which offers many other exciting possibilities

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: HUSH+ARRR wallets will probably support it first, and then others

Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content:
@jl777c Seeds generation work fine with curls. Checked all langs you listed above.
You can log in with them in html wallet no problem.

Few problems: (on latest jl777 branch)
1. Using api call: http://127.0.0.1:7771/api/method/getnewaddress   results in error `{"error":"cant find methodfile"} `
2. If there is no lang supported passed ass param (AE: "lang": "svensk", or typo like "lang": "englih"), you will get random data as seed.
```json
:~/libnspv$ curl --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getnewaddress", "params": ["englih"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:12986/

{"seed":"19 1789 1601 670 516 1566 1734 726 857 77 1692 855 1129 1183 1203 948 1350 1447 1741 998 1263 1003 1593","wif":"Uq6bnT9VPGnfJCn9NPQ6fVzZdtELQS5XThhZ7jhND942ExWKyErt","address":"RTaTmrR3TgK4gBmiC5Ru9Tg2HzZWmx5S32","pubkey":"0331eea382ac2b308eb98ebdd1e8f3b05fea2ddd6af5d5f0068015e781e54a6236","wifprefix":188,"compressed":1}
``` 
It's probably better to either default unknown langs to english, similair to "lang": "", or throw an error instead.

Will recheck nspv build for WIn soon.

Content: Judging by this error here - https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/atomicDEX-API/issues/501#issuecomment-516940954 - we're past the Boost build on raspbian, e.g. we don't have a full mm2 build there yet, but Boost builds NP, because this errors happens after the Boost build.
